trans-unit.source: A trigger action that removes a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard"></xref>.
Use <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RemoveStoryboard> with a <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> or <xref:System.Windows.Trigger> to remove a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>.
Pause, Resume, Stop, Remove, or Otherwise Control a Storyboard Interactively

To be able to pause, resume, remove, or otherwise control a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> interactively, set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> property of its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> and use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ControllableStoryboardAction> object (such as <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.PauseStoryboard>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.ResumeStoryboard>, or <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.StopStoryboard>) to control it by referencing its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Name%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard> is unspecified, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.Storyboard%2A> cannot be interactively controlled after it is begun.

See [How to: Use Event Triggers to Control a Storyboard After It Starts](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-use-event-triggers-to-control-a-storyboard-after-it-starts.md) for more information.

You should use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RemoveStoryboard> action to remove any storyboards begun with a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.BeginStoryboard.HandoffBehavior%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.HandoffBehavior.Compose>.
It's also a good idea to remove background animations when the object they animate is no longer being used.

For example, if you apply an indefinitely repeating storyboard using an element's <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Loaded> event, you should also create an <xref:System.Windows.EventTrigger> that uses a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.RemoveStoryboard> action to remove the storyboard on the element's <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Unloaded> event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.RemoveStoryboard"></xref> class.
